@ironmagma Well, I don't think I'd be much help for programming, but I could be helpful in other areas.

erm... the ability to talk to the natives or the ability to eat the native vegetation and fauna.  I`m just seeing so much more potential for Riven in this generation of gaming.  I`ve seen a lot of what other games do well, specifically games like Oblivion and Morrowind which allow for a lot of freedom and flexibilty and versatility in the gameplay.  This tends to lend well to the feeling of exploration.  It would be neat to see more non -linear elements of gameplay than was permitted before in Myst.  Imagine for example that the player does something dangerous on jungle island while exploring off the path; this could be anything from swimming near the Wahrk Gallows or eating a piece of poisonous fruit.  Something totally unexpected could happen as a consequence.  Instead of dying, the player might wake up several hours later in a hut in the jungle village having been rescued by one of the Rivenese natives.  The player could then easily explore the jungle village among the natives and get to experience another perspective of Riven and Rivenese culture.  Just saying.  I think allowing for more gameplay versatility could allow for a deeper sense of exploration.
Please let us explore Tay.  That`s been my one main dream since discovering Riven.

Also, I`d like to add this too:  I think incorporating some more modern rpg/sandbox elements would do well too.  i.e: the ability to pick up and use objects (a torche for exploring at night, a musical instrument, a knife or a fork) being able to freely move across the land - including swimming - and maybe the abiliy

@Yali while all the idea of a non-linear or super-interactive Riven is certainly interesting, I think that currently the idea of making regular ole' linear Riven is daunting enough for us. We might think about adding the option to open up the gameplay in the future, but for now we're sticking with remaking the original.
I'm not sure if many people know about Starry Expanse project - I'm sure there's a way you can penetrate this project over the net. Viral videos anyone?
Um, you can't just decide to make a video that's viral. Unless it has cats doing quasi-human things in it.
I just put myself in first place on the members list by starring all of my comments. Boy, am I bored today.
@Shimmey I like how Convore is set up. For this sort of project it works well.

Hey all, I just a quick question for you regarding forums and Convore. Would you prefer a more structured, moderated forum with categories for topics and such, or do you like the simplicity and informal nature of Convore for discussing the project and getting your ideas heard?
I really like what we've got going here. I think forums would only be better if this were a community project.
Also, we need a Convore link added to the top of the Starry Expanse page for when that post is no longer at the top of the page.
Will do.

Hi, guys! Yesterday, I made a donation and signed up for beta testing. I would've done so sooner, but I didn't know about this project at all until about 48 hours ago. I just stumbled upon it while poking through some other forum. Anyways, good luck in finishing the game and getting Cyan's approval. I can't imagine why they'd turn it down, given what I've seen of the game so far. It looks top-notch. (And hi, Zib! I believe I conversed with you once or twice, either in a forum or in the Cavern, many moons ago). Cheers!
